intro: Codonopsis javanica subsp. javanica, commonly known as the Javan codonopsis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers, which range in color from white to pale blue, bloom in late summer and are followed by small, oval-shaped fruits.
